page.title: 08West Southampton Schools 1
page.content: We surveyed three schools in the western part of the D-Block. Here are some things we found out. {Northcliffe School}is a private school, situated near the junction of the M27 and M271. Before the motorway was built it was an isolated rural school. The building is called{Grove {Place}and there is a long, tree-lined drive to the entrance. We were told by the headmaster,Mr David Owens, that the school was opened in 1965. There are{114 pupils} and{10 teachers}. The largest class has 17 pupils and the smallest has 10. The pupils board at the school and wear school uniform. There are some day pupils who come by bus and cars. The school has a playing field, a library, swimming pool, four pianos, four computers, a tv and video. They do not hold school discos.
